MIDIConnectionEvent.summary: The MIDIConnectionEvent interface of the Web MIDI API is the event passed to the event of the interface and the event of the interface. This occurs any time a new port becomes available, or when a previously available port becomes unavailable. For example, this event is fired whenever a MIDI device is either plugged in to or unplugged from a computer.

MIDIConnectionEventMIDIConnectionEvent.summary: The MIDIConnectionEvent() constructor creates a new object. Typically this constructor is not used as events are created when a new port becomes available, and the object is passed to the event.

MIDIConnectionEventPort.summary: The port read-only property of the interface returns the port that has been disconnected or connected.
